title: (x) Duvel neon sign - (similar to) Linotype Auferstehung {Yves}
content:
Probably, custom but anything close would help.  
It's vectrex, gridnik alike, no!?  
Thanx masters!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [duv\_112.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110302213256/http:/typophile.com/files/duv_112.jpeg) | 66.55 KB |
author: mr_ampersand

comments.content:
Mmmmm! One of my favourite beers. This is just based on their [logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20110302213256/http:/www.duvel.be/), but you might like [Fakir](http://web.archive.org/web/20110302213256/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=fakir&id2=overview) by [Underware](http://web.archive.org/web/20110302213256/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Underware).

Why not draw something yourself? Do you have much text to set?

Duvel has been explored before on Typophile:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/31519](http://web.archive.org/web/20110302213256/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31519 "http://www.typophile.com/node/31519")

BTW: Searching Typophile is easy, but one has to use Googleâ€¦  
Start your searchcriteria with  
**typophile:**

\_\_\_  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

Thanx Bert,

I don't think i asked to explore Duvel, or am i wrong?  
I want letters close to this neon sign.  
But thanx for your didactic info.

What Bert meant is that before you ask for an identification, it's always a good idea to check if your question hasn't already been answered previously. In this case, exploring Typophile using the Google search would've given you the thread he linked to. In that thread the Duvel logo has been dealt with.

If you want something similar to the actual neon sign though, take a look at [Linotype Auferstehung](http://web.archive.org/web/20110302213256/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/linotype_auferstehung_virtual/).

Sorry, didn' want to sound rude.  
But i had checked th typophile google search and i had watched that topic.  
But the demand is different. So i thought it was okay to post my demand.  
Thanx for the help!
